ca.ualberta.team7project.controllers

Class LocationController

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
          • android.app.Activity
            • ca.ualberta.team7project.controllers.LocationController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.location.LocationListener, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback, PositionListener

    public class LocationController
extends android.app.Activity
implements PositionListener
    Handles location functionality for the entire application.

    Uses the android LocationManager, Location and Geocoder to update LocationModels for both the user and the sorting preferences.

    For simplicity (since we aren't concerned with battery life), this LocationController is always willing to accept connections.

    This controller makes heavy use of error checking since any errors have multiplicative effects for the rest of the application.

        public java.lang.Boolean updateCoordinates(android.location.Location location)
        Is called when the GPS/Network updates the position.

        Longitude/Latitude are saved and UserModel is updated.

        Parameters:
        location - of the GPS or network position
        Returns:
        update True if the location was updated properly.

      • forceLocationUpdate

        public void forceLocationUpdate()
        Force a location update from locationManager

        If the user never moves from the original location, then onLocationChanged() is never called. Therefore, this method is used to ensure that we have a location for the user.

        Specified by:
        forceLocationUpdate in interface PositionListener
